org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit

Class SystemPrivilegesPermissionTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit.SystemPrivilegesPermissionTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class SystemPrivilegesPermissionTest
extends BaseTestCase
    This class tests the basic permission classes for system privileges.

      • dirPathImpls

        private static final boolean[][] dirPathImpls
        The matrix defining which of the above directory paths imply each other. For instance, dirPathImpls[1][2] shows the expected value for:
        • DP("directory:*").implies(DP(directory:level0"))
        • DP("directory:./*").implies(DP(directory:./level0"))
        • DP("directory:/*").implies(DP(directory:/level0"))
        • DP("directory:/dummy/..*").implies(DP(directory:/dummy/..level0"))

      • VALID_SYSPERM_NAMES

        public void testSystemPermissionCollections()

      • serializeDeserialize

        private static <T> T serializeDeserialize(T object,
                                          java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Exception> expectedException)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Serialize an object, then deserialize it from where it's stored, and finally return the deserialized object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object being serialized
        Parameters:
        object - the object to serialize
        expectedException - the type of exception being expected during deserialization, or null if deserialization is expected to be successful
        Returns:
        the deserialized object, or null if deserialization failed as expected
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred
